summary: So a random thought popped into my head; in Captain America: TWS when Bucky pulls Steve out of the river did he hold him with...
body: So a random thought popped into my head; in Captain America: TWS when Bucky pulls Steve out of the river did he hold him with his metal arm and swim up with the dislocated shoulder or did he hold Steve with the dislocated one and swim up with the metal one before he put him on the riverbank either way he went through some pain to pull Steve from the river

body:
Supernatural and accidental Avengers parallel

After Nihilism I couldn’t help but notice the accidental avengers parallel. In IW Strange saw 14000605 alternate endings and avengers win in only one of them. On 14x10 Billy said only one book details the possibilty of defeating Michael. Then I remembered 14x20 premiers a day before End Game releases lol. It’s basically nothing but a fun parallel.

tags: is youre wondering why i was reblogging ip man gifs earlier
title: Doctor Strange’s Martial Arts
body:
Besides a doctor and a sorcerer, Stephen Strange also is a martial artist. So, what kind of style he uses? Comparing his movements and posture, his style looks like Wing Chun A LOT.  It was the Style Ip Man and Bruce Lee used, in the movies, the first focusing more in explosive offensive with punching, the second focusing more in kicking and using other weapons. The Wing Chun already granted victory to Ip Man against American boxers, men way physically stronger and bigger than him. (Real facts).

A you can see, the main position focuses on giving emphasis to the center, so arms and legs give the body a large base, the fighter lowers his own height, sending their weight down so their balance will get more stable. One hand stays right ahead, to they can deflect a punch by moving the opponent’s arm laterally and soon after that, attack with the the free hand.

Another main focus of the Wing Chun is kicking, a kick that often tries to hit the opponent’s knee to incapacitate them and prevent them from running after their target, considering the main focus is self defense, it was known as “women fighting style” in the past. Since fire arms were rare in China back then, self defense was way more common, it was taught to women, children and even elderly. According to Ip Man, Wing Chun doesn’t depend of gender or age, it’s about technique of knowing where to hit while sparing energy.

Of course we also see Stephen training with other weapons in the deleted scenes and in Infinity War, we can assume he learned a lot of different styles, but mainly, it seems to be Wing Chun. But why? Wing Chun is a martial art that focus in self defense. The objective is to incapacitate the enemy as fast as possible, not to kill or cause permanent injuries. The hits are focused on more vulnerable spots so the fight will end quickly, many will use that opportunity to run away from the aggressor and call the police, considering the main objective of martial arts in urban life is to escape danger.

Also, one of the features of the Wing Chun style is to use the elbows to defend and attack, something that’s ideal for Stephen Strange considering the pain he feels every time he punches because of his injured hands. We can see that use of the elbows in the gif below. In the movie, Stephen uses his elbows to attack Mordo’s neck (target sensible parts) and to escape when Mordo grabbed him from behind.

Stephen uses his elbows as the main focus of his fighting because his hands are always injured. Also, he gets advantage of his height to push the opponents down and make them lose their balance. Look how Stephen targets the throat! A sensible spot. No matter how strong the enemy is, it’s impossible to make your neck or knees stronger, they’re fragile structures. The coolest part is that Stephen is a doctor, he knows anatomy, he knows where to hit.

Stephen uses his elbow to break free from Mordo wrapping his arms around his neck. The move Mordo used is very common in urban environments, when a guy grabs another from behind while the rest hits him and indeed, hitting who grabbed you with your elbow is one of the best way out, considering their ribs will be exposed for you to hit, also, the elbow is one of the hardest structures of our body, very difficult to break.

One of the main principles of the technique is to redirect strong punches and kicks with soft movements to externalize the hits, avoiding them and creating an opening to attack, which often is explosive. As we can see, Stephen uses that principle to block Mordo’s hits. If you notice the movement of Stephen’s legs, you’ll also see how it’s connected to Wing Chun.

During the Doctor Strange extras, it was mentioned many different fighting styles were researched in order to build the fighting scenes and Benedict’s training (and the other actors’) and one of the styles was the one used by Bruce Lee, that’s the Wing Chun, the style we’re talking about. It doesn’t requite too much flexibility like other fighting styles and it doesn’t take a lifetime to master it, that’s why one of its objectives is self defense, people don’t have to train 20, 30 years to have interesting results. Of course the more you train, the better you get.

Another main focus of the Wing Chun is kicking, a kick that often tries to hit the opponent’s knee to incapacitate them and prevent them from running after their target, considering the main focus is self defense, it was known as “women fighting style” in the past. Since fire arms were rare in China back then, self defense was way more common, it was taught to women, children and even elderly.
